edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.tasks

Class IdentifyParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • edu.ucdavis.cstars.client.tasks.IdentifyParameters

  • public class IdentifyParameters
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
    This data object is used as the identifyParameters argument to IdentifyTask.execute method. It specifies the criteria used to identify the features.
    Author:
    Justin Merz

      • getDpi

        public final int getDpi()
        Resolution of the current map view in dots per inch. Default value: 96
        Returns:
        int

      • setDpi

        public final void setDpi(int dpi)
        Set the dpi parameter.
        Parameters:
        dpi - - Resolution of the current map view in dots per inch. Default value: 96

      • getDynamicLayerInfos

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<DynamicLayerInfo> getDynamicLayerInfos()
        An array of DynamicLayerInfos used to change the layer ordering or redefine the map. When set the Identify operation will perform the identify against the dynamic layers. (As of v2.7)
        Returns:
        JsArray

      • setDynamicLayerInfos

        public final void setDynamicLayerInfos(DynamicLayerInfo[] dynamicLayerInfos)
        Set the dynamicLayerInfos parameter.
        Parameters:
        dynamicLayerInfos - - An array of DynamicLayerInfos used to change the layer ordering or redefine the map. When set the Identify operation will perform the identify against the dynamic layers. (As of v2.7)

      • getGeometry

        public final Geometry getGeometry()
        The geometry used to select features during Identify. The type of the geometry is specified by Geometry type. The most common geometry used with Identify is a Point.
        Returns:
        Geometry

      • setGeometry

        public final void setGeometry(Geometry geometry)
        Set the geometry parameter.
        Parameters:
        geometry - - The geometry used to select features during Identify. The type of the geometry is specified by Geometry type. The most common geometry used with Identify is a Point.

      • getHeight

        public final int getHeight()
        Height of the map currently being viewed in pixels.
        Returns:
        int

      • setHeight

        public final void setHeight(int height)
        Set the height parameter.
        Parameters:
        height - - Height of the map currently being viewed in pixels.

      • getLayerDefinitions

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayString getLayerDefinitions()
        Array of layer definition expressions that allows you to filter the features of individual layers. Layer definitions with semicolons or colons are supported at version 2.0 if using a map service published using ArcGIS Server 10.
        Returns:
        JsArrayString

      • setLayerDefinitions

        public final void setLayerDefinitions(java.lang.String[] layerDefinitions)
        Set the layer definitions parameter.
        Parameters:
        layerDefinitions - - Array of layer definition expressions that allows you to filter the features of individual layers. Layer definitions with semicolons or colons are supported at version 2.0 if using a map service published using ArcGIS Server 10.

      • getLayerIds

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayInteger getLayerIds()
        The layers to perform the identify operation on. The layers are specified as a comma-separated list of layer ids. The list of ids is returned in ArcGISMapServiceLayer layerInfos.
        Returns:
        JsArrayInteger

      • setLayerIds

        public final void setLayerIds(int[] layerIds)
        set the layerIds parameter.
        Parameters:
        layerIds - - The layers to perform the identify operation on. The layers are specified as a comma-separated list of layer ids. The list of ids is returned in ArcGISMapServiceLayer layerInfos.

      • getLayerOption

        public final IdentifyParameters.LayerOption getLayerOption()
        Specifies which layers to use when using Identify. Default value: LAYER_OPTION_TOP
        Returns:
        LayerOption

      • setLayerOption

        public final void setLayerOption(IdentifyParameters.LayerOption layerOption)
        Parameters:
        layerOption - - Specifies which layers to use when using Identify. Default value: LAYER_OPTION_TOP

      • getLayerTimeOptions

        public final com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArray<LayerTimeOptions> getLayerTimeOptions()
        Array of LayerTimeOptions objects that allow you to define time options for the specified layers. There is one object per sub-layer.
        Returns:
        JsArray

      • setLayerTimeOptions

        public final void setLayerTimeOptions(LayerTimeOptions[] layerTimeOptions)
        Set the layerTimeOptions parameter.
        Parameters:
        layerTimeOptions - - Array of LayerTimeOptions objects that allow you to define time options for the specified layers. There is one object per sub-layer.

      • getMapExtent

        public final Extent getMapExtent()
        The Extent or bounding box of the map currently being viewed. The mapExtent property is assumed to be in the spatial reference of the map unless sr has been specified. The values for mapExtent, height, width, and dpi are used to determine the layers visible in the current extent. They are also used to calculate the search distance on the map based on the tolerance in screen pixels.
        Returns:
        Extent

      • setMapExtent

        public final void setMapExtent(Extent mapExtent)
        Set the mapExtent parameter.
        Parameters:
        mapExtent - - The Extent or bounding box of the map currently being viewed. The mapExtent property is assumed to be in the spatial reference of the map unless sr has been specified. The values for mapExtent, height, width, and dpi are used to determine the layers visible in the current extent. They are also used to calculate the search distance on the map based on the tolerance in screen pixels.

      • getMaxAllowableOffset

        public final float getMaxAllowableOffset()
        The maximum allowable offset used for generalizing geometries returned by the identify operation. The offset is in the units of the spatialReference. If a spatialReference is not defined the spatial reference of the map is used.
        Returns:
        float

      • setMaxAllowableOffset

        public final void setMaxAllowableOffset(int maxAllowableOffset)
        Set the maxAllowableOffset parameter
        Parameters:
        maxAllowableOffset - - The maximum allowable offset used for generalizing geometries returned by the identify operation. The offset is in the units of the spatialReference. If a spatialReference is not defined the spatial reference of the map is used.

      • returnGeometry

        public final boolean returnGeometry()
        If "true", the result set includes the geometry associated with each result. The default is "false".
        Returns:
        boolean

      • setReturnGeometry

        public final void setReturnGeometry(boolean returnGeometry)
        set the returnGeometry parameter.
        Parameters:
        returnGeometry - - If "true", the result set includes the geometry associated with each result. The default is "false".

      • getSpatialReference

        public final SpatialReference getSpatialReference()
        The spatial reference of the input and output geometries as well as of the mapExtent. If the spatial reference is not specified, the geometry and the extent are assumed to be in the spatial reference of the map, and the output geometries will also be in the spatial reference of the map.
        Returns:
        SpatialReference

      • setSpatialReference

        public final void setSpatialReference(SpatialReference spatialReference)
        Set the spatialReference parameter.
        Parameters:
        spatialReference - - The spatial reference of the input and output geometries as well as of the mapExtent. If the spatial reference is not specified, the geometry and the extent are assumed to be in the spatial reference of the map, and the output geometries will also be in the spatial reference of the map.

      • getTimeExtent

        public final TimeExtent getTimeExtent()
        Specify the time extent used by the identify task.
        Returns:
        TimeExtent

      • setTimeExtent

        public final void setTimeExtent(TimeExtent timeExtent)
        Set the timeExtent parameter.
        Parameters:
        timeExtent - - Specify the time extent used by the identify task.

      • getTolerance

        public final double getTolerance()
        The distance in screen pixels from the specified geometry within which the identify should be performed.
        Returns:
        double

      • setTolerance

        public final void setTolerance(double tolerance)
        Set the tolerance parameter.
        Parameters:
        tolerance - - The distance in screen pixels from the specified geometry within which the identify should be performed.
